Editorial:
Welcome to issue 208 of the Azure Weekly Newsletter. This week's main announcements seem to focus on App Service, DevOps & Monitoring and lots of Power BI!

  • Microsoft Azure portal January 2019 update
  • .NET Core 2.2 is available for App Service on Windows
  • App Service Environment Support for Availability Zones (Preview)
  • Azure SQL Database: Upgraded infrastructure for monitoring and alerts
  • Azure Monitor logs in Grafana - now in public preview
  • 'Azure Migrate is now available in Asia and Europe'
  • the Azure DevOps Bounty Program
  • GitHub Enterprise support and automatic GitHub service connections in pipelines
  • Final reminder: OMS portal moving to the Azure portal
  • General availability: Azure Availability Zones in East US 2
  • HDInsight is now supported in Azure CLI as a public preview
  • Azure Marketplace new offers â€“ Volume 29
  • Updates for Developing Custom Visuals for Power BI by Ted Pattison
  • Power BI dataflows January updates
  • Personal Bookmarks in the Power BI Service
  • Power BI Developer community December update
  • Microsoft Azure obtains Korea-Information Security Management System K-ISMS certification
  • New Azure Storage Explorer & AzCopy integration feature
  • Power BI Embedded Status API tracks workspace assignment to capacities
  • Power BI Embedded API for capacity workload configuration
  • Public preview: Token-based identity for Azure AD users in SQL Database
  • Power BI Embedded supports Q&A with row-level security
